message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL 

The paper discusses the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and their limitations in recognizing co-dependent visual features over long spatial ranges. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper then introduces the horizontal gated-recurrent unit (hGRU) to address this limitation, which is a type of recurrent neural network (RNN) and falls under the neural networks (cs.NE) sub-category. The paper also compares the performance of the hGRU to other feedforward hierarchical baselines, which falls under the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper discusses the biological plausibility of the hGRU in comparison to anatomical data from the visual cortex, which falls under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses human behavioral data on a classic contour detection task, which falls under the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category.
